bentoncounty_gistools package

Submodules

bentoncounty_gistools.bentoncounty_gistools module

bentoncounty_gistools.bentoncounty_gistools.add_nfi(project_map, service)[source]

Updates a web mab to include the natural features inventory.

Parameters

  • project_map – The web map to update with the NFI.

  • service – The natural features inventory feature collection service.

Returns

None (modifies project_map)

bentoncounty_gistools.bentoncounty_gistools.create_layer_id(layerIndex)[source]

Generate random ids for layers. Copied verbatim from https://community.esri.com/t5/arcgis-api-for-python-questions/python-api-add-group-layer-to-webmap/td-p/1112126.

To build a web map from a published service, we generate feature layers pointed to each service. Each feature layer requires a unique layer id, produced by this function.

Parameters

layerIndex – Layer index number.

Returns

A randomized string to serve as a unique id.

Return type

str

bentoncounty_gistools.bentoncounty_gistools.fc_gen(layer, opacity=1.0)[source]

To create group layers, we wrap each service in a feature layer. This function formats the feature layer based upon the service layer.

Parameters

  • layer (MapServiceLayer) – Source for feature layer.

  • opacity (float) – Opacity of feature layer.

Returns

Feature layer data for map service layer.

bentoncounty_gistools.bentoncounty_gistools.layer_urls(item)[source]

List service layer urls.

Parameters

item – Service with target layers.

Returns

A list of urls for layers in the service.

Return type

list[str]
